lines.text: I wept today because right had been done.
No, not justice. Right. Easy to do justice. Very hard to do right.
Oh, you still pursue your feminist activities?
Oh, do you really think so, Sir Robert? How little you know about women. Good-bye. I doubt that we shall meet again.
Oh, do you really think so, Miss Winslow? How little you know about men.
One thing puzzles me. Why are you always at such pains to prevent people knowing the truth about you, Sir Robert?
You know that you are. Why?
Which of us knows the truth about himself?
My dear Miss Winslow, are you cross-examining me?
You don't behave as if you are in love.
How does one behave as if one is in love?

[Looks at the book Catherine is reading]
One doesn't read "The Social Evil and The Social Good." One reads Lord Byron.
